meanings.meaning_en_US: To depend on someone or something for support or help.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 依賴某人或某事以獲得支持或幫助

examples.sentence: You can always [rely on] your friends in tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難時期，你總是可以依賴你的朋友。

examples.sentence: Many people [rely on] technology for their daily tasks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人依賴科技來完成日常任務。

examples.sentence: We need to [rely on] proven methods for success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要依賴有效的方法來獲得成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become higher or to shift upward, commonly in reference to clothing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變高或向上移動，通常是指衣物

examples.sentence: Her dress tends to [ride up] when she sits down.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的裙子在坐下時經常會往上滑。

examples.sentence: The waistband of my pants keeps [riding up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我褲子的腰帶總是往上滑。

examples.sentence: I hate it when my shirt [rides up] while I'm working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我討厭在工作時，襯衫往上滑的感覺。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To cheat someone, especially by charging too much or giving them less than what they are owed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 欺騙某人，特別是收取過高的費用或給予他們少於應得的東西

examples.sentence: They really ripped me off at that store.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在那家商店真的欺騙了我。

examples.sentence: I felt like I was being ripped off during the negotiation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我覺得在談判中我被欺騙了。

examples.sentence: He ripped off his clients by charging them double.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他通過向客户收取雙倍價格來欺騙他們。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remove something forcefully or suddenly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 強行或突然地移除某物

examples.sentence: He ripped out the page from his notebook.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從筆記本中撕下了那一頁。

examples.sentence: She ripped out the weeds from the garden.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她從花園中撕下了雜草。

examples.sentence: I accidentally ripped out the plug while cleaning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在清理時不小心撕下了插頭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To arrive in large numbers or a large amount.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 大量到達或大量出現

examples.sentence: Guests started to roll in around 7 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 客人們於晚上7點左右開始陸續到達。

examples.sentence: The profits rolled in after the new campaign launched.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新活動啟動後，利潤開始大量進來。

examples.sentence: Rain clouds began to roll in just before the storm.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 暴風雨來臨前，雲彩開始聚集。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To transfer a quality or characteristic to someone or something through contact.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過接觸將某一特質轉移到某人或某物身上

examples.sentence: His enthusiasm has really rubbed off on me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的熱情真的對我產生了影響。

examples.sentence: The paint will rub off if you touch it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你碰到它，油漆會剝落。

examples.sentence: She hopes her good habits will rub off on her friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望她的好習慣會影響到她的朋友。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To erase or remove something, especially marks or writing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擦掉或移除某物，特別是標記或文字

examples.sentence: He rubbed out the mistakes with an eraser.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他用橡皮擦掉錯誤。

examples.sentence: I need to rub out this pencil mark.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要擦掉這個鉛筆痕跡。

examples.sentence: They rubbed out the graffiti on the wall.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們擦掉了牆上的塗鴉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attempt to achieve a position or office in an election.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 企圖在選舉中獲得一個職位或官職

examples.sentence: She decided to run for mayor in the upcoming election.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定在即將到來的選舉中參選市長。

examples.sentence: He has announced that he will run for re-election.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他已宣布將參選連任。

examples.sentence: Many people encourage her to run for the council.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人鼓勵她競選議會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To leave quickly, typically to avoid a situation or person.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 快速離開，通常是為了避免某種情況或某人

examples.sentence: They ran off before anyone could catch them.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在任何人能抓住他們之前就迅速逃走了。

examples.sentence: She decided to run off and start a new life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定逃離，開始新的生活。

examples.sentence: The dog ran off the moment it saw the open door.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那隻狗在看到打開的門的時候立刻跑了出去。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have no more of something left.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 沒有剩下任何東西

examples.sentence: We ran out of milk, so we need to buy some.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們的牛奶用完了，所以需要買一些。

examples.sentence: They ran out of time before completing the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在完成項目之前，他們時間用完了。

examples.sentence: I always run out of battery on my phone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我的手機總是沒電。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accumulate savings or money over time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隨著時間的推移累積儲蓄或金錢

examples.sentence: I need to save up for a new car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要存錢買一輛新車。

examples.sentence: They have been saving up for their vacation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們一直在為假期存錢。

examples.sentence: She saved up enough money to buy a house.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她存了足夠的錢去買房子。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say goodbye to someone at the beginning of their journey.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某人旅行開始時向其告別

examples.sentence: I went to the airport to see him off.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我去機場送他。

examples.sentence: She saw her friend off at the train station.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在火車站告別了她的朋友。

examples.sentence: They planned to see off the guests at the hotel.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們計劃在酒店送客人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To submit something, typically a document or application, for consideration.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提交某物，通常是文件或申請，以供考慮

examples.sentence: You need to send in your application by the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要在截止日期之前提交申請。

examples.sentence: They will send in their report next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將在下週提交報告。

examples.sentence: I recommend that you send in your resume early.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我建議你儘早提交你的簡歷。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin a journey or start an activity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開始旅程或啟動活動

examples.sentence: We set off early to avoid traffic.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們很早出發以避免交通。

examples.sentence: He plans to set off on his trip next month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他計劃下個月開始旅行。

examples.sentence: She set off to explore the city after breakfast.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她早餐後出發去探索城市。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin an endeavor or journey with a particular intention.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以特定意圖開始一個努力或旅程

examples.sentence: They set out to make a difference in the world.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們開始努力改變世界。

examples.sentence: We set out on our journey at dawn.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在黎明時開始了旅程。

examples.sentence: She set out to prove her point during the debate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在辯論中，她開始試圖證明自己的觀點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To arrive or appear at a place.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 到達或出現在某個地方

examples.sentence: He always shows up late to meetings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是遲到開會。

examples.sentence: She didn't show up for her appointment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她沒有來赴約。

examples.sentence: They finally showed up after an hour of waiting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在等了一個小時後終於出現了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To confine someone indoors or within a restricted space.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某人限制在室內或狹小空間內

examples.sentence: He felt shut in during the long winter months.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在漫長的冬季，他感到被限制在室內。

examples.sentence: The storm shut us in the house for days.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 暴風雨將我們困在家裡好幾天。

examples.sentence: She shut her dog in the yard while she cleaned.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在清理時把狗關在院子裡。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop talking or to cause someone to stop talking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 停止講話或使某人停止講話

examples.sentence: I wish they would just shut up.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望他們能夠閉嘴。

examples.sentence: He told her to shut up during the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在爭吵期間，他告訴她閉嘴。

examples.sentence: They were told to shut up and listen.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們被告知要閉嘴並聆聽。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To register one's presence, often by providing one's name or other details.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 註冊個人出席，通常是提供姓名或其他詳細信息

examples.sentence: Please sign in at the reception desk upon arrival.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 到達時請在接待台登記。

examples.sentence: You need to sign in to access the online system.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要登錄才能訪問在線系統。

examples.sentence: She signed in for the conference before it started.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議開始之前，她登記了參加。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To agree to participate in a task or organization.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同意參加任務或組織

examples.sentence: He signed on to help with the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他同意幫助這個項目。

examples.sentence: She signed on as a volunteer for the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她簽約作為活動的志願者。

examples.sentence: They signed on for a year of service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們簽約為期一年的服務。
